channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2024021062
item.description:
Report X-2024021062

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T18:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiber board box with signs of release was discovered during sort operations at the MEMH facility. The fiberboard box contained 38 glass bottles in individual plastic bags with dunnage material. Three of the bottles inside were broken releasing contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024021023
item.description:
Report X-2024021023

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-04
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The damaged package was brought to the HWPA in a lined tote. No other information is known. DescribePack: The cap came completely off one of the bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The carton was placed in a plastic tote along with an absorbent pad. Gloves were worn during processing.

item.title: Report X-2024021008
item.description:
Report X-2024021008

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: OOLTEWAH

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Sequence of events unknown due to lack of communication from sort in which incident happened. DescribePack: Package failed due to cap closures on bottles leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package mitigation consisted of putting package in an open contents bin and leaving for OB QA.

item.title: Report X-2024021021
item.description:
Report X-2024021021

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-09
  • City: CHATTANOOGA
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was in transport to the van line when the package started to leak. Upon discovery the package was placed into a black tote and brought to QA. DescribePack: Shipping container wet at the corner of the package. Two bottles of the solution are cracked at the seam under the handle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: containers sat upright to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2024021031

Report X-2024021031

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Sequence of events unknown due to lack of communication from sort in which incident happened. DescribePack: Package failed due to body being crushed from it being dropped. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package mitigation consisted of putting box in an open contents bin and leaving it for OB QA to process.

item.title: Report E-2024020346
item.description:
Report E-2024020346

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-14
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS regarding (6) 1-qaurt containers of Klean Strip Acetone that were crushed and punctured by a forklift. This resulted in the release of 2-quarts of Acetone onto the concrete dock floor. A Contractor cleaned the spill and containerized the damaged product into a UN-rated shipping container for disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by the release.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package discovered leaking while unloading DescribePack: Loose cap DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Package brought to QA, QA processed using neutralizer and placed in a salvage drum

item.title: Report X-2024020649
item.description:
Report X-2024020649

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T18:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-25
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking fiberboard box without DOT label, proper shipping name or UN number. Package placed in lined tote and removed from operations. DescribePack: Three of three 121oz plastic bottles collectively lost 35oz of fluid due to loose cap closures, despite child-resistant caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, ventilation utilized.

item.title: Report X-2024020698
item.description:
Report X-2024020698

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T18:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-25
  • City: CHATTANOOGA
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being sorted to the van when it fell off of the line and hit the ground. Upon impact with the ground the caps came off of the containers and the liquid contents spilled out. DescribePack: Caps loosely on the gallon containers. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Containers were placed upright to stop the spillage.

item.title: Report X-2024020671
item.description:
Report X-2024020671

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T18:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-25
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking fiberboard box found with pH ~ 1-2. Package removed from operations and taken to HMPA in lined tote. DescribePack: One of two 1 gallon plastic jerricans lost 1 gallon of fluid via pinhole puncture due to impact with sharp object. Please note that pinhole effectively sealed itself, even withstanding light pressure. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned and ventilation used.

item.title: Report X-2024020670
item.description:
Report X-2024020670

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T18:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-26
  • City: KINGSPORT
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package Handler delivered HAZMAT to truck to be loaded and set the package down. Package Handler started noticing a smell and turned to find it leaking and immediately notified management. Ops Mgr Nate Perry and Ops Mgr Mike Martin controlled the disturbed area and were able to contain the spill/HAZMAT. DescribePack: 1 glass 4 Liter bottle broken in half DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Ops Mgr's Nate and Mike contained the spill using folding absorbent pads.
